item.title: By: Fred Butler
item.dc:creator: Fred Butler
item.content:encoded:
Just so I am clear, when you write,

Human authorial intent as the end-all of interpretation is a post-Enlightenment phenomenon and, in essence, has caused several generations of Evangelical interpreters to shun pre-critical hermeneutical practitioners as worthy examples of biblical interpretation.

You don’t have in mind the historical-grammatical hermeneutic that attempts to discover the meaning of the biblical author are you? You’re just thinking about aberrant forms of hermeneutics that take a purely naturalistic view of the Biblical text?
